sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, elhoim, Tim Shelton (fps, alias support), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Program Files (x86)\Test\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\msiexec.exe /V; CommandLine=powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -File wix.ps1; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.

match_context.values: @{query=ipinfo.io}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=h,
        [string]$arguments
    )
    Write-DebugLog "[Create-LNK] Path='$lnkPath', Target='$targetPath', Args='$arguments'"
    try {
        $ws = New-Object -ComObject WScript.Shell
        $sc = $ws.CreateShortcut($lnkPath)
        $sc.TargetPath       = $targetPath
        $sc.Arguments        = $arguments
        $sc.WorkingDirectory = "C:\Windows\System32"
        $sc.IconLocation     = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\Edge\Application\msedge.exe"
        $sc.Save()
        [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=163; ScriptBlockId=3039785b-2c94-428f-bf8f-9bf459bec3af; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=163}

@{ScriptBlockText=x37, 0x8d, 0x5a, 0x77, 0xea, 0x69, 0x75, 0xad, 0xc3, 0x8e, 0xee, 0xa8, 0x8e, 0x5a, 0x9b, 0x83, 0x34, 0x95, 0x59, 0x87, 0xe8, 0x41, 0x74, 0xed, 0xc2, 0xc6, 0xef, 0x18, 0x8f, 0x7a, 0x9a, 0x9b, 0x35, 0xbd, 0x58, 0x77, 0xe8, 0x69, 0x7b, 0x55, 0xca, 0x56, 0xe7, 0x80, 0x28, 0xca, 0x4d, 0x27, 0x92, 0x55, 0xff, 0x8f, 0x4f, 0x69, 0x73, 0xad, 0xc5, 0x8e, 0xe8, 0xc8, 0x88, 0xba, 0x9d, 0xbb, 0x32, 0xbd, 0x5f, 0x6f, 0xef, 0x61, 0x72, 0x95, 0xc4, 0xde, 0xe9, 0x40, 0x89, 0xda, 0x9f, 0x7b, 0x30, 0xfd, 0x5d, 0x3 [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=121; ScriptBlockId=cf69c8cc-d38e-41f1-856f-2955d9e83638; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=121}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=h,
        [string]$arguments
    )
    Write-DebugLog "[Create-LNK] Path='$lnkPath', Target='$targetPath', Args='$arguments'"
    try {
        $ws = New-Object -ComObject WScript.Shell
        $sc = $ws.CreateShortcut($lnkPath)
        $sc.TargetPath       = $targetPath
        $sc.Arguments        = $arguments
        $sc.WorkingDirectory = "C:\Windows\System32"
        $sc.IconLocation     = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\Edge\Application\msedge.exe"
        $sc.Save()
        [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=3039785b-2c94-428f-bf8f-9bf459bec3af; MessageTotal=163; MessageNumber=163; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=x37, 0x8d, 0x5a, 0x77, 0xea, 0x69, 0x75, 0xad, 0xc3, 0x8e, 0xee, 0xa8, 0x8e, 0x5a, 0x9b, 0x83, 0x34, 0x95, 0x59, 0x87, 0xe8, 0x41, 0x74, 0xed, 0xc2, 0xc6, 0xef, 0x18, 0x8f, 0x7a, 0x9a, 0x9b, 0x35, 0xbd, 0x58, 0x77, 0xe8, 0x69, 0x7b, 0x55, 0xca, 0x56, 0xe7, 0x80, 0x28, 0xca, 0x4d, 0x27, 0x92, 0x55, 0xff, 0x8f, 0x4f, 0x69, 0x73, 0xad, 0xc5, 0x8e, 0xe8, 0xc8, 0x88, 0xba, 0x9d, 0xbb, 0x32, 0xbd, 0x5f, 0x6f, 0xef, 0x61, 0x72, 0x95, 0xc4, 0xde, 0xe9, 0x40, 0x89, 0xda, 0x9f, 0x7b, 0x30, 0xfd, 0x5d, 0x3 [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=cf69c8cc-d38e-41f1-856f-2955d9e83638; MessageTotal=121; MessageNumber=121; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Program Files (x86)\Test\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Hashes=MD5=F65B029562077B648A6A5F6A1AA76A66,SHA256=4A6D0864E19C0368A47217C129B075DDDF61A6A262388F9D21045D82F3423ED7,IMPHASH=EE1E569AD02AA1F7AECA80AC0601D80D; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine=powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -File wix.ps1; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\4nuzvj50\4nuzvj50.cmdline"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Program Files (x86)\Test\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\msiexec.exe /V; CommandLine=powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -File wix.ps1; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a new office macro files on the systems

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates\~$Normal.dotm}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\4nuzvj50\4nuzvj50.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\kbn1vtl3\kbn1vtl3.cmdline}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\-r3wtpwt.cmdline}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Dotted Quad Host Base64-Encoded Powershell Payload
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING Dotted Quad Host Base64-Encoded Powershell Payload"; flow:established,to_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; http.stat_code; content:"200"; http.response_body; content:"frombase64string"; fast_pattern; distance:0; nocase; content:"iex"; distance:0; nocase; reference:url,www.huntress.com/blog/malware-deep-dive-examining-a-powershell-payload; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2063007; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, affected_product Windows_11, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_06_16, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Moderate, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, tag PowerShell, updated_at 2025_06_16, mitre_tactic_id TA0002, mitre_tactic_name Execution, mitre_technique_id T1059, mitre_technique_name Command_And_Scripting_Interpreter; target:dest_ip;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: (http_inspect) 'HTTP' in version field not all upper case
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:119; sid:246; rev:2; msg:"(http_inspect) 'HTTP' in version field not all upper case"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)
alert ( gid:119; sid:279; rev:1; msg:"(http_inspect) invalid status line"; metadata: rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO PS1 Powershell File Request
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO PS1 Powershell File Request"; flow:established,from_client; flowbits:set,ET.PS.Download; http.request_line; content:".ps1 HTTP/1."; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2032162; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_03_18, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_03_18;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Powershell Base64 Decode Command Inbound
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http any any -> [$HOME_NET,$HTTP_SERVERS] any (msg:"ET INFO Powershell Base64 Decode Command Inbound"; flow:established,from_server; file.data; content:"[System.Text.Encoding]"; nocase; content:"[System.Convert]::FromBase64String"; nocase; fast_pattern; within:100; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2036760; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2022_06_02, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Minor, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2022_06_02, reviewed_at 2024_05_07;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Observed DNS Query to Cloudflare workers.dev Domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO Observed DNS Query to Cloudflare workers.dev Domain"; dns.query; dotprefix; content:".workers.dev"; nocase; endswith; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2051767; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Any, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_03_22, deployment Perimeter, malware_family Cloudflare_Workers, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Cloudflare_Workers, updated_at 2024_03_22;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Observed Cloudflare workers.dev Domain in TLS SNI
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Observed Cloudflare workers.dev Domain in TLS SNI"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; dotprefix; content:".workers.dev"; endswith; fast_pattern; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2051768; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Any, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_03_22, deployment Perimeter, malware_family Cloudflare_Workers, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Cloudflare_Workers, updated_at 2024_03_22;)
